author: Will Leitch
title: Review: Understanding ‘Superfans’
text:
Despite what many filmmakers or artists will tell you, you can certainly be a critic of film or painting without ever having actually made a film or a painting yourself: One does not need to be able to create an egg to definitively determine that one is rotten. Writers can stand outside their own experiences to understand experiences different from those they’ve had—and, in fact, writers likely benefit from bringing fresh eyes to a work of art.
But can you write about being a fan, without being one yourself? After reading...
